body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.86-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2487/folder/13176877/41237352/1089918656 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** ibellicotest+2230@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Critical User Impact **Device used:** Motorola MotoG60 / Android 12 / Chrome ( mWeb / Hybrid app) - Windows 11 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Prerequisite: Account has Self DM. Prerequisite 2: Account has a workspace with workflows disabled. 1. Open the staging.new.expensify.com website. 2. Create a manual expense and submit it to Self DM. 3. Tap on "Submit it to someone" option on whisper message. 4. Select a workspace and submit the expense to it. 5. Open the expense report. 6. Note that "Unexpected error submitting this expense" and "Unexpected error deleting this expenses" error messages appear on report. 7. Dismiss the errors. 8. Note that you are redirected back to chat, and report is now displayed empty. 9. Reopen report. 10. Note that infinite skeleton loader is displayed. 11. Tap on "More" 12. Note that there is no option to delete the empty report. 13. Tap on "Retract" 14. Note that no action is triggered. ## Expected Result: User should be able to submit a track expense to a workspace, even if workflows are disabled. ## Actual Result: "Unexpected error submitting this expenses" and "Unexpected error deleting this expenses" error messages appear at the same time when submitting a track expense to a workspace with workflows disabled. Also, when errors are dismissed, report displays infinite skeleton loader and it can´t be deleted or retracted. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/93dc0f3c-9e0d-45a2-b732-a8786c5963f3 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.86-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** No **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** Exploratory around https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2487/folder/13176706/41236839/1089918348 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** kiatest.80+ck12222540@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Critical User Impact **Device used:** Windows 11/Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: Precondition: 1. Workspace has Company cards feature 2. Few members invited to workspace 1. Navigate to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to Company cards page >> Click Add Cards 3. Select Direct Feed >> Other >> Complete the flow using Plaid card 4. Click Assign card >> Assign card to any member 5. Click Feed dropdown >> Add Cards >> Upgrade workspace if not done already 6. Select Commercial feed >> MasterCard Commercial feed >> Complete the flow 7. Click Feed dropdown >> Select Direct feed 8. Click Settings >> Remove card feed >> Delete 9. Click Settings >> Remove card feed >> Delete ## Expected Result: Company Cards empty state with Add cards button should be displayed ## Actual Result: Infinite loading on Company Cards page after removing all feeds ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c554c53a-ccfc-4c67-8bbc-4d9b54ae4e41 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** **Reproducible in staging?:** Needs Reproduction (Unable to reproduce) **Reproducible in production?:** Needs Reproduction **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** **Logs:** https://stackoverflow.com/c/expensify/questions/4856 **Expensify/Expensify Issue URL:** **Issue reported by:** @scerrato88 **Slack conversation** (hyperlinked to channel name): [#Expensify Bugs](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C049HHMV9SM/p1766420869109809) ## Action Performed: 1. Log in as an admin user 2. Verify the admin has access to the bank account ending in Expensify Classic 3. Open New Expensify 4. Attempt to reimburse a report using the same bank account. ## Expected Result: Admin should be able to reimburse using the bank account ending in 0297, consistent with Classic behavior. ## Actual Result: Reimbursement fails in New Expensify. An error message `No withdrawl bank account could be found` is displayed, blocking reimbursement. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: Add Top Spenders default report

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

type.name: Feature
type.description: A request, idea, or new functionality

body:
# Part of the Insights project Main issue: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/570577 Doc section: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1zMWsgWBXY5Lx4V1M8LVTovOaTX-q34LempKIKWH8rwI/edit?tab=t.0#heading=h.mvmf31h2iib Project: # Feature Description Add a new default report called `Top Spenders` to the Reports page. In order to do this, we will: 1. Add a new section to the Reports page LHN called `Insights` that lives above explore a. This section will only be shown when there is at least one Insights report to display 2. Within the `Insights` section add a `Top Spenders` report a. The report should only be shown if the user is an admin, auditor, or approver on a workspace b. The query for this report is `type:expense group-by:from date:last-month sort-by:groupTotal sort-order:desc` When there is nothing to display, we'll use the same empty state as Reports > Expenses
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @

title: [$250] Hide assigned Guide/AM from invite and assign-card contact lists

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
Slack Thread Context: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07HPDRELLD/p1766428570391939?thread_ts=1766080442.521409&cid=C07HPDRELLD **What the problem is:** New customer onboarding shows the assigned Guide or Account Manager (AM) in the contact lists for the "Invite new members" dialog and the "Assign card" flow. This causes confusion during sign-up (users accidentally select the Guide instead of the intended colleague) and adds noise to the invite flow, negatively impacting onboarding clarity and conversion. **What the expected output is:** - Do not show the currently assigned Guide or AM in the contacts list inside the "Invite new members" workspace invite dialog and the "Assign card" flow. - Users must still be able to add a Guide/AM by entering their full email address manually (i.e., suppression only from the suggested contacts list, not from explicit email entry). - If a Guide/AM becomes unassigned from the customer, they should appear again in those contact lists (normal behavior once no longer assigned). - Guides/AMs should continue to appear in the Chat contacts/search list (no change to chat visibility). **Debugging info:** - Reported user behavior: during sign-up the UI sometimes unselects the intended invitee and selects the Guide, and this has occurred multiple times in one onboarding session (example: admin invited ~8 people and repeatedly saw the Guide suggestion). - Guides are currently treated as validated accounts and therefore appear in contact suggestions by default. - Prior investigation notes: hiding the Guide specifically is straightforward on the front end; more complex cases (e.g., historical contacts like a former salesperson without an @expensify.com email) were identified as not straightforward. - A domain-based suppression (@expensify.com / @team.expensify.com) was discussed as a broader alternative but the agreed starting point is to suppress only the currently assigned Guide/AM in the specified flows. **Potential solutions or implementation notes:** - Front-end change: suppress any contact suggestion that matches the currently assigned Guide or AM when rendering the contact list for the "Invite new members" dialog and the "Assign card" flow. - Keep the suppression scoped to the contacts list UI only — do not block invites or assignments by explicit email entry. - Ensure suppressed Guides/AMs reappear automatically when they are no longer assigned to the customer. - Keep Chat contact/search behavior unchanged so Guides/AMs remain discoverable via chat. Created with the :create-gh-issue: automation

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.85-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176924/test-cases/41237586 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** lattelover1412+2212nn@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Regression TC Execution **Device used:** Win11/Chrome **App Component:** Other ## Action Performed: Precondition: on the web browser logged in with OD >> create a workspace and add expensifail account B as a member Step: 1. Open the link www.staging.new.expensify.com 2. Create a new account with a public domain email address 3.In the modal “What’s your work email?”, enter the email address of account B (the same account invited in OD) 4. Click "Add work email" 5, Enter magic code 6. complete the onboarding flow ## Expected Result: ND page should load successfully and display the workspace/dashboard without requiring navigation away. ## Actual Result: After completing onboarding, the ND page shows endless loading. If the user navigates away from the current page and returns, the endless loading stops. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/2ffa22b9-80d5-4f5b-9b4f-056639e13b70 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
